blocks.name: acongid
blocks.content: A wff like that in this theorem will be known as an "alternating congruence". A special symbol might be considered if more uses come up. They have many of the same properties as normal congruences, starting with reflexivity. JonesMatijasevic uses "a ≡ ± b (mod c)" for this construction. The disjunction of divisibility constraints seems to adequately capture the concept, but it's rather verbose and somewhat inelegant. Use of an explicit equivalence relation might also work. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Oct-2014.)

blocks.name: acongsym
blocks.content: Symmetry of alternating congruence. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Oct-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm acongsym(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, cneg(c2))))), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, c1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, cneg(c1)))))
} = {
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, cneg(c2)))), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, c1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, cneg(c1)))))
  orim12d(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, cneg(c2))), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, c1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, cneg(c1))))
  3impia(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, c1))))
  exp32(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, c1)))
  congsym(c0, c1, c2)
  biimpd(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, cneg(c2))), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, cneg(c1))))
  breq2d(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, cneg(c2)), co(c2, cmin, cneg(c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  eqtr3d(co(c1, cmin, cneg(c2)), co(c2, cmin, cneg(c1)), co(cneg(cneg(c1)), cmin, cneg(c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  oveq1d(cneg(cneg(c1)), cmin, cneg(c2), c1, w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  negnegd(c1, w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c1, cc))
  neg2subd(cneg(c1), c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(cneg(c1), cc))
  negcld(c1, wcel(c1, cz))
  zcn(c1)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c2, cc))
  zcn(c2)
}

blocks.name: acongneg2
blocks.content: Negate right side of alternating congruence. Makes essential use of the "alternating" part. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Oct-2014.)

blocks.name: acongtr

  ex(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wa(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c2, cmin, c3))), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, c3)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, cneg(c3)))))

blocks.name: acongrep
blocks.content: Every integer is alternating-congruent to some number in the first half of the fundamental domain. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Oct-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm acongrep(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz)), wrex(s0, co(nat0, cfz, c0), wo(wbr(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmin, c1)), wbr(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmin, cneg(c1))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  rexlimddv(hs0, co(nat0, cfz, co(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cmin, nat1)), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz)), wrex(s0, co(nat0, cfz, c0), wo(wbr(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmin, c1)), wbr(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmin, cneg(c1))))), wbr(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cdvds, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz)), wrex(hs0, co(nat0, cfz, co(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cmin, nat1)), wbr(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cdvds, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1))), wcel(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cn), wcel(c1, cz))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(co(nat2, cmul, c0), cn), wcel(nat2, cn), wcel(c0, cn))
